title: Surprise Ministry Audit
description: Two auditors from the ministry appear at your door, unannounced. They want to see documentation.

options.label: Drop everything and assist
options.outcome: You spend the day pulling files and answering questions. They seem satisfied.

options.label: Ask to reschedule
options.outcome: They agree to come back next week. You have time to prepare... or worry.

options.label: Delegate to your team
options.outcome: Karen handles it. She finds a few gaps but smooths them over.

title: Audit Findings Released
description: Last quarter's audit results are in. There are "concerns" about referral documentation.

options.label: Accept findings and remediate
options.outcome: You allocate budget to fix the gaps. It's the mature response.

options.label: Request reconsideration
options.outcome: You push back respectfully. Some findings reduced but relationships strain.

options.label: Blame the previous administration
options.outcome: Classic move. It works politically but colleagues notice.

title: Angry Stakeholder Call
description: The Chief of a partner Nation is on the line. They're not happy about something in Block 7.

options.label: Listen and apologize
options.outcome: You hear them out. By the end, tensions have eased. A site visit is promised.

options.label: Explain the regulatory constraints
options.outcome: You walk through the rules. They understand but feel dismissed.

options.label: Offer to halt operations pending review
options.outcome: A dramatic gesture. It costs production but rebuilds trust.

title: Community Complaint
description: A petition from the local community lands on your desk. Concerns about truck traffic.

options.label: Schedule a town hall meeting
options.outcome: You set up an evening session. Good turnout, reasonable discussion.

options.label: Send a written response
options.outcome: A detailed letter explaining safety measures. Polite but distant.

options.label: Redirect to the ministry
options.outcome: You forward it to the proper authority. Not your problem now.

title: Media Inquiry
description: A reporter is asking questions about your latest timber sale. Tone seems skeptical.

options.label: Give a full interview
options.outcome: You spend an hour explaining the complexities. Story is balanced.

options.label: Provide a written statement only
options.outcome: Controlled messaging. The story runs with minimal quotes.

options.label: Decline to comment
options.outcome: "Company declined to comment." Never looks great.

title: System Crash
description: The permit tracking database just went down. IT is "looking into it."

options.label: Switch to paper backup
options.outcome: Old school but functional. Productivity drops but work continues.

options.label: Send everyone home early
options.outcome: Nothing can be done without the system. Team appreciates the break.

options.label: Escalate to management
options.outcome: You make noise. IT prioritizes your fix. Still lost half a day.

title: GIS Data Corrupted
description: The spatial files for three pending permits are corrupted. Backups are weeks old.

options.label: Rebuild from field notes
options.outcome: Painful work but you reconstruct the data. Lost two days.

options.label: Request extension from ministry
options.outcome: They grant it but note the delay in your file.

options.label: Submit with old data and notes
options.outcome: It might pass review. It might not.

title: Budget Cut Announced
description: Finance just announced a 15% reduction to your operating budget. Effective immediately.

options.label: Accept and adjust plans
options.outcome: You revise the work plan. Some projects will wait.

options.label: Fight for restoration
options.outcome: You make the case upstairs. Partial restoration granted.

options.label: Find alternative funding
options.outcome: You scramble for grants and partnerships. Stressful but effective.

title: Policy Change
description: New guidelines just dropped. Your current permits need additional documentation.

options.label: Comply immediately
options.outcome: Extra paperwork but you stay ahead of enforcement.

options.label: Request grandfathering
options.outcome: Existing permits exempted. New ones still need the extra work.

options.label: Join industry pushback
options.outcome: You sign onto the letter. Implementation delayed.

title: Leadership Shuffle
description: Your ministry contact just got transferred. The replacement starts next month.

options.label: Rush pending items through
options.outcome: You push hard to get things approved before the change.

options.label: Prepare a transition briefing
options.outcome: Good relationship management. The new contact appreciates it.

options.label: Wait and see
options.outcome: Things slow down during the transition. Expected.

title: Team Conflict
description: Two of your team members had a heated argument in the break room. Tensions are high.

options.label: Mediate directly
options.outcome: You sit them down together. Issues aired, partial resolution.

options.label: Assign them to separate projects
options.outcome: Physical distance helps. Underlying issue remains.

options.label: Bring in HR
options.outcome: Formal process begins. Professional but cold.

title: Resignation Notice
description: Your most experienced analyst just gave two weeks notice. Better opportunity.

options.label: Counter-offer with raise
options.outcome: They stay. Budget takes a hit but continuity preserved.

options.label: Wish them well and plan transition
options.outcome: Professional departure. Knowledge transfer happens. It's not the same.

options.label: Guilt trip about timing
options.outcome: They stay an extra month but relations sour. Then they're gone.

title: Office Illness
description: Something is going around the office. Three people called in sick today.

options.label: Redistribute workload
options.outcome: Those present pick up slack. Tiring but manageable.

options.label: Push back deadlines
options.outcome: You notify stakeholders of delays. Understanding varies.

options.label: Bring in temps
options.outcome: Agency staff fill the gap. Quality suffers but output continues.

title: Early Permit Approval
description: The ministry fast-tracked one of your applications. Approved ahead of schedule!

options.label: Celebrate with the team
options.outcome: You buy everyone coffee. Morale soars.

options.label: Use momentum to push others
options.outcome: You leverage the goodwill to accelerate other applications.

options.label: Document what worked
options.outcome: You analyze why it went smoothly. Lessons for next time.

title: Partnership Opportunity
description: A First Nation partner offers to co-lead the referral process for their territory.

options.label: Accept enthusiastically
options.outcome: A collaborative approach begins. Slower but richer outcomes.

options.label: Accept with conditions
options.outcome: You set boundaries on scope. Partnership starts carefully.

options.label: Defer pending capacity review
options.outcome: You punt to later. Opportunity may not come again.
